message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.HCI. 

The paper discusses the user experience (UX) of machine learning (ML) systems in two case studies, one involving a clinical decision-support system and the other involving an intelligent text editor. The paper focuses on the complexities and nuances of how people engage with ML systems, which suggests a strong emphasis on human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and human-centered computing (cs.CY). The use of natural language processing (NLP) technologies in the second case study also suggests a connection to computational linguistics (cs.CL) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper's overall focus on designing ML systems that are accessible, useful, and trustworthy to all suggests a connection to human-computer interaction (cs.HCI).
